UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user profile with associated information and game statistics.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user profile.

totalScore.description: The user's total score across all games.

highestLevel.description: The highest level the user has reached.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user profile was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user profile was last updated.

GameSession.title: GameSession
GameSession.description: Represents a single game session, including the score achieved and difficulty.

id.description: Unique identifier for the game session.

score.description: The score achieved in this game session.

difficulty.description: The difficulty level of the game session (e.g., easy, medium, hard).

seed.description: The seed used to generate the game level.

startTime.description: Timestamp indicating when the game session started.

endTime.description: Timestamp indicating when the game session ended.

definition.description: Stores user profile data. This collection uses path-based ownership, where the document ID is equal to the user's Firebase Auth UID.

params.name: userId
params.description: The Firebase Auth UID of the user.

definition.description: Stores game session data for each user. Includes denormalized 'userProfileId' for authorization independence. The document ID for game_sessions is a unique ID generated when game session is initiated.

params.name: userProfileId
params.description: The Firebase Auth UID of the user who owns this game session. Denormalized from the UserProfile.

params.name: gameSessionId
params.description: The unique ID of the game session.

firestore.reasoning: This Firestore structure prioritizes security and scalability for the Definition Detective game. User profiles and game sessions are organized to ensure data ownership and prevent unauthorized access. We leverage path-based ownership and avoid `get()` calls in security rules for Authorization Independence. The structure supports listing operations (QAPs) by clearly separating user-owned data. The design denormalizes userProfileId into GameSession to remove hierarchical authorization dependencies.
